I'd recommend watching Zoolander (2001) if you're in the mood for a hilarious comedy with an A-list cast, including Ben Stiller, Owen Wilson, and Will Ferrell. In this film, a fashion-obsessed model is brainwashed to assassinate the Prime Minister of Malaysia, leading to a series of absurd and humorous events.

If you're interested in a more dramatic slapstick movie, Nell (1994) featuring Jodie Foster might be worth checking out. This film tells the story of a woman living isolated in the woods who is eventually discovered and brought into society, resulting in surprising consequences for both her and those around her.

If you're looking for a movie with a thrilling narrative, I would recommend "Taken" starring Liam Neeson. The story revolves around a father who stops at nothing to save his daughter from kidnappers in Paris.

For something more comedic and offbeat, you might enjoy "Spaceballs", a hilarious parody of Star Wars featuring the talents of Mel Brooks, John Candy, Rick Moranis, and Bill Pullman.
